column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Brazilian tribe is neither a new discovery nor a hoax
#Text=Wednesday , June 25 , 2008
#Text=In late May to early June of 2008 , news broke that a previously undiscovered indigenous tribe had been found near the border between Brazil and Peru .
#Text=Worldwide media was quick to publish the story and the accompanying photographs taken by José Carlos Meirelles .
#Text=The photos showed people in full body paint aiming bows at the overhead aircraft from which the pictures were taken .
#Text=Wikinews
#Text=covered the story as well .
#Text=In its Sunday edition , British newspaper
#Text=The Observer

#Text=had a story called " Secret of the ' lost ' tribe that was n't " which was about this " discovery " and revealed that the tribe had in fact been known to scientists , including Fundação Nacional do Índio ( FUNAI ) , the Brazilian protection agency for Indian interests .
#Text=Some of the media got very carried away and started talking about undiscovered tribes
#Text=— Fiona Watson
#Text=After this revelation , media newswires branded the original story a hoax .
#Text=These hoax claims spread nearly as quickly as the original story .
#Text=Rapidly , news sites even claimed that the photos were fake .
#Text=The true story , however , is more complicated than that .
#Text=The Observer '
#Text=s article featured an interview with José Carlos Meirelles , one of a handful so-called sertanistas that work for the FUNAI .
#Text=These are field agents that map the areas of uncontacted indigenous peoples , so that their habitat can be protected .
#Text=He admitted that his desire to protect these tribes had caused him to overstep his mission .
#Text=When given the use of an aircraft to seek out new tribes , Meirelles instead flew over an area where he knew a tribe had been observed decades ago .
#Text=Ultimately , he was hoping to prove that FUNAI 's policy of not contacting the tribes they observe is better for the tribes .
#Text=With this flight he hoped to find evidence that the tribe , discovered long ago , was better off for not being contacted .
#Text=" When I saw them painted red , I was satisfied , I was happy , " he said .
#Text=" Because painted red means they are ready for war , which to me says they are happy and healthy defending their territory .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Nevertheless , Survival International said it did not mislead media because it never described the tribe as  lost " .

column1: #Text=" These Indians are in a reserve expressly set aside for the protection of uncontacted tribes : they were hardly ' unknown ' , " said Stephen Corry , director of Survival International in a statement .
#Text=" What is , and remains , true , is that so far as is known these Indians have no peaceful contact with outsiders .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Some of the media got very carried away and started talking about undiscovered tribes , " explains Fiona Watson of Survival International .

column1: #Text=" There was this interpretation that this was a completely new tribe , completely undiscovered , without bothering to check with sources ...
